knimeNode.name: Generic Run-to-time Loop Start
knimeNode.shortDescription: Loop start node to repeatedly process entire input table until a specified time of day has passed.

intro.p: Loop start node to repeatedly process entire input table until a specified time of day has passed. The user can specify the time (hh:mm) at which the last iteration will start before. The loop will execute until that time period has elapsed. If connected to a Run-to-time Loop end, the unprocessed rows table will be empty for this node as all rows are processed repeatedly on each loop iteration.

This node was developed by Vernalis Research . For feedback and more information, please contact
knime@vernalis.com

fullDescription.option: The time at which execution will finish (hh : mm)
If the expiry time has already passed today at the time of loop execution commencement it will run until that time tomorrow
If the expiry time (accounting for the 'Run to tomorrow' setting) is on a Saturday or Sunday, then the loop will run until that time on the following Monday
Allows the user to manually set the value at which the iteration counter will start (does not affect the processing of the table!)
